gallery.description: A portrait taken of me hours before walking for my high school graduation, May, 22, 2022

Parking enforcement assistant Michael Shaw monitors traffic and greets students, staff and visitors to the University of Texas on Tuesday, Sept. 10, 2024, at his post on 24th Street and Whitis Avenue in Austin, Texas. A university-wide celebrity among students and staff, Shaw and his daily motivational catchphrases promote optimism and positivity within the community.

First-year civil engineering students JoonHa Kim (left) and Trina Ha (right) sit together after their chemistry class on Tuesday, Sept. 13, 2024, outside the G. B. Dealey Center for New Media at the University of Texas in Austin, Texas. Knowing each other since high school in Houston, Texas, Kim and Ha talk about what the next four years will look like.

A collection of multicolored pottery vases sits on display on Thursday, Sept. 12, 2024, near the door of Sfingiday, a small women-owned boutique selling handmade goods located on S Lamar Boulevard in Austin, Texas. Sfingiday prioritizes local producers, and its pieces are curated by owner and founder Christine Olson, according to its website.

A demolition crew continues its deconstruction of Whitis Court on Tuesday, Sept. 10, 2024, at the University of Texas in Austin, Texas. A historical resident hall, Whitis Court opened in 1953 and is scheduled to reopen in 2027 with an additional 800 beds to adjust for the universityâ€™s growing student body.
